text:
Cute little place with tasty and authentic food. The lady who runs the floor is super sweet with accommodating large parties. The service was spot on.

Drunken noodles level 2 spice was perfect. 
Pepper steak level 3 sneaks up on you a bit but it was good and flavorful.

So I came here with my wife, cousin and two kids. It was a last minute decision and I have to say, it was fantastic!!!!! We got the orders of Pad Kee Mao (Drinkin Noodles) and one General Tso Chicken plane (sorry for misspelling it). The only problem we really had was the onion. Our dishes had a lot of onions that took almost 1/3 our plate. OTHER THAN THAT THOUGH, the quality and quantity is there!!! I would come back to this place when visiting Vegas!!
Food is average ,delivery and time scheduling very very terrible ... Schedule time and had too wait an hour after schedule d time will not order from again.

chose this location because of the great reviews. my experience wasn't as great as I wish it would have been.. ordered food for delivery and missed something from my order. my vegetable chow mien was super oily... I did however order a yummy green tea boba.. it was delicious but I do have this pet peeve where I don't get a boba straw. very hard to get the little tapioca balls. over all not a go to Thai food restaurant for me..

I will forever come to this place for the service alone. Their female server learned my bf's and I full order after the second time we came there. She literally remember my order better than my boyfriend does because one time he called to pick up, walked in and she said: oh no, if I know it was you we would have left out the onions in your pad Thai. She apologized profusely for something that my partner of 2 years didn't even remember.  She always fill up our drinks even before it gets halfway (my bf goes through like at least 4 cups per dinner and we never find a server that can keep up with him).I seriously cannot rave enough about this woman.

Their food is really well done too. I always get their shrimp pad Thai because the shrimps are always cooked perfectly. Most places really overcook their shrimp making it rubbery. Their orange chicken is hands down the best we've ever had, I know, surprising considering it's a Thai place.  But between the service and the food I plan on coming for the foreseeable future!

So here is my review of this thai place, we ordered thai som tham (papaya salad) and they didn't put the little dried shrimps which is kind of the main ingredient if you get this dish anywhere else, the other food was ok, however I will say the prices are good, and u get a decent portion .

If the quality was better I would give it 5 stars for sure, but with this being said if u want thai food, and cheap...give this place a shot maybe it's better than my review.

-Alex

This place is packed today! If you have a big party of 6 or more, reservation is recommended. Sticky rice with mango is so good! And the price is by far the cheapest in town. ( trust me I have been trying many thai places)
I went here during lunch time,restaurant was packed but the service was still superb. The only complaint was it took longer time to wait for the food.

I love Thai food and Dang and her gang does it perfect!  We are regulars and go at least twice a month.  We almost get the same thing every time,  Won Ton soup and Potstickers, and the best Phad Thai ever!  OH, Dang I forgot to mention all the cilantro that I get!  The service is suburb and they remember us and our order down to the drinks!   The restaurant is shinny and clean.  Thanks guys,  and we will see you soon!

Orderered take out while staying at Hard Rock Hotel.  Food was fresh and tasty.  

Got the Thai Basil Chicken with fried egg on top.  Good portion size and great price.

The best place around UNLV. Best service, the nicest people and really the best food!
Highly recommended

I saw all the great reviews and wanted to try this place for takeout! The delivery service was very prompt but the food... The pad kee mao and the chicken sate were both over cooked beyond belief! I've tried two other Thai restaurants in the area and unfortunately this has been my least desired experience. I plan on giving them one more shot by dinning in the restaurant but until then.

My only problem is they don't deliver during lunch hours. How inconvenient. Regardless the food was awesome. My mom ordered the Panama Curry lunch special and I ordered the Grilled Spareribs lunch special. Both were extremely good and filling, especially at such a low price. The salad was a little heavily dressed, but I just poured off the extra. Also they forgot the egg roll.  I did fine without it, but I like to get what I pay for. I'm just sad I live 45 minutes from this place. I thought I had finally found my Thai spot. :(

1) Pad See Ew w/ chicken *9/10 chicken pieces could have been smaller 

2) Pad Thai w/chicken *6/10 too sweet & too many bean sprouts 

3) Spicy Basil Fried Rice w/chicken & shrimp ; spicy 3/5
+Came with maybe about 6-7 pieces shrimp in this dish. 
*Recommend to SPICE LOVERS 10/10!

+ CLEAN restaurant 
+ Came on a Thursday & not busy at all , so seated right away.
+ Staff was polite and friendly 
 
 20/20 overall. Will definitely come back!!

To-go orderers, taste your order before you leave! 

I ordered chicken pumpkin curry to go, I asked for the lowest level of spice (I've had it before so I know how it tastes like), they gave me a level 4.. I paid almost $10 for it and I had to throw most of it away because I couldn't handle it. I was tired and hungry and they were abt to close, I didn't taste it til I got home..

Nice environment, expected Thai dishes. I'm sure they could make weird dishes if you asked politely. The dessert selection is good. Accurate spice level (1-5). This place is never busy when I'm there. The owners are friendly, from Bangkok and are interesting to talk to even though it's hard to hear through their accents. Only downside is it can be pricey for dinner. Their lunch specials are around $7 without a drink.

Came here for lunch in between classes.

I got a lunch special. It comes with:
Soup of the Day
Salad
Main Dish

I like the portion sizes, variety of food, and taste (especially for the price), but the service was so-so.  At least when I was there, they treat tables of 2 or more with friendlier service than single tables.  When they were not busy, they stand behind the counter staring at the door waiting for more customers.

Wow very disappointing!!! I have tried many Thai restaurants.  Saw this one and decided to give it a try. The Thai beef salad was edible but really lacking ..in taste and presentation,as the lettuce was one piece of clump. But I wanted to try the Seafood salad as well..which was a huge mistake. Not only is it priced a bit high, but it was terrible with few pieces of seafood that seemed laid out for some other use and dumped into the salad. The Seafood salad was lacking in flavor and taste.it seemed to be left out at room temperatures and again a clump of lettuce. I have tasted much Thai food in my travels and this was my worst in quality, taste and pricing. I won't be back...

The food here is really good! My friends & I went around lunch time & we all had lunch specials. It's really great prices for everything they give you! For less than $6 we got a salad & soup plus our meal with a delicious egg roll! So far we got chow mein, pad Thai, & curry & all were very good! The owner is very sweet as well! (:

I got recommend from my friend to try this Thai Resturant by UNLV. For short review, it a small Thai place with huge selection. I had Curry puff FOR APPERTIZER which is quite good. PANANG CURRY for my main dish, just on par. I had medium spicy, but it is too much for me.

The service was excellent. The lady server is really nice. 

I took one star down because it is too cold. Might because we are the only table eating at the time. We didn't ask them to turn on the heat though.

I have been here at least 10 times, and I always come by myself.  This isn't a very fancy place.  It's a place to come when you want a good meal.  I always order the same thing, the Cashew Nut with tofu, level 3 (spicy levels 1-5).  It's extremely delicious.  Their portions are a little smaller than other Thai restaurants in the area, but the food is a little more flavorful than other places.  Overall, it's a really good meal.

If you're looking for great service, this isn't your place.  This restaurant appears to be a family operation.  There aren't any professional waiters here.  It's definitely not fancy.  I probably wouldn't recommend this place if you were on a romantic date.  However, this is the perfect place for anyone who wants to walk away with a belly full of good Thai food at a reasonable price.

Soup and salad is awesome, I tried vegetable fried rice and it was awesome. !!

Lunch special is must look for.

I'm really not satisfied with this place ,just had my food delivered not only did they take an hour or so to get here... The worse part was finding a black piece of hair in my food beyond disgusting and disappointing . Never again I wouldn't recommend this place the food has no flavor !! About the only thing I give a thumbs up is there Thai tea!!!
It's really nice Thai restaurant which is serving tasty Thai food.  I would like to recommend Thai tea for drink!! No doubt to come here for the tasty food with inexpensive price.

The food is absolutely delish. I went for the very first time today and loved it. Great food for the right price. If you're looking to try something new, this is the place to go. I'd definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Visiting from Colorado on a Wednesday at lunch.  The waitress was the warmest and most attentive person, constantly bouncing between all the tables and never missing any detail.  Amazing service.

Ordered pot stickers, yellow curry spicy level 3, pad Thai spicy level 1, and chicken fried rice.  I would not order the pot stickers again, the were good but nothing amazing.  The pad Thai, curry, and fried rice were all 10 out of 10.  The curry was the best I've ever had.  There is a reason this place has such a high rating.  Food is amazing and service is top notch.  

I'll be back here every time I'm in town.
Favorite delivery Thai restaurant close to the strip!! We order from here almost once a week and it's always delicious. Not to mention, quick delivery.

This is one of the only places I have "a usual" at. The orange is crispy without being overwhelming and they're cream cheese ragoons have a spice you can't quite put your finger on. For $15.85 I'm able to split one meal for two days. It's an awesome place!

Tried this restaurant with my friends from high school. Food is excellent and the duck red curry is  so good. I love the papaya salad and the their pad thai. We ordered the chef fried rice too .
Worth a visit and very reasonable.

Came here for lunch from work. Quick, friendly service, good place for a lunch break. Got two lunch specials. I got pork pad Thai which doesn't come with rice. Good, a little spicier than I expected (not a bad thing!). The salad was tasty. My companion ordered the chicken spicy basil, spiciest as possible. She enjoyed it, liked the heat level. It had a lot of string beans, like, a lot. But overall quite good. She didn't care for the soup or salad. We also ordered egg rolls. I liked them, but my companion did not.
Good Food, Good Service. A great place to go for cheap and convenient thai food. Very authentic like my mother's cooking.

I only got takeout from here, but the experience was pretty darn swell. Placed an order via Eat24, drove to pick it up from the restaurant about 15 minutes after, walked in, was greeted promptly, with my order bagged and ready to go. When I got it home, the food was still hot, the order was made to my specific instructions (pad see ew, no egg, with tofu), and the napkin/flatware was packaged in a mylar sleeve so it didn't get moist from the steam. And now my belly is full.

FYI - The restaurant has a $15 credit card minimum, which is typical for small businesses who can't afford to eat the CC processing fees, but they'll just charge you a quarter if your CC charge is less than $15.

Eat here all the time.   The only Thai place I get better food is my Girlfriend's Mom's house and this is just as authentic.  It's small and the only tiny complaint I have is that the wait staff can sometimes be a bit too attentive, by refilling my glass every time it's had a drink or two out of it.

Serving sizes fit the price. It was nice to be able to get three entrees to try a variety. The salads were spectacular (Papaya and Waterfall-Nam Tok) as was the Spicy Basil Chicken.

Granted it is a down home dive but everything you want in a dive.

Fresh ingredients.

Again, dump the casinos and eat local. Choa has very good Thai food. We had the chicken dumpling and the crab cheese puffs  for apps and they were very good and the sauce for both was excellent. My wife had sesame chichen and I had broad noodles with pork and broccoli in a spicy brown garlic sauce and it was very good too and we will return.
Decent pad thai. They had their kids in the restaurant and they were loud.

I was irritated when doing my last review. I drove there on a sat not realizing they were closed. Now that I know I've gone a few more times and every time I try something new it's my new favorite. I drive 20 min each way even though there is closer places and places that can delivery to me because it's really that good. Very accommodating of  my vegetarian diet

I eat here fairly often for lunch and I will say that it is my favorite Thai place in Vegas and arguably one of my top Thai places of all time! *Kanye voice* 

Service fluctuates depending on who's helping you. The older, shorter woman normally serves me and she's great. Very fast, attentive, and she even memorized my usual order. My cup of water never gets below half because she refills it so often. However the other taller younger woman is slow to take your order and rarely comes by the table. It was like pulling teeth to get her to come by and refill my water, but it might be reluctance due to the language barrier. Luckily the younger woman has only been my server twice. 

The calamari appetizer is delicious and the lunch specials are pretty good with decent portions. The specials come with a small soup, salad, chips, rice, and of course the entree. I've had the orange chicken as well as the sesame chicken and both were excellent.

However 90% of the time I order my personal favorite, pad see ew with chicken, which unfortunately is not on the lunch menu so it's a bit pricier albeit not too bad. They ask you how spicy you want it (1-5) and I usually go with 1 or 2. I learned the hard way not to be a hero and go 3+ because it will slowly burn your mouth until becomes hell incarnate. The noodles aren't overly oily like I've seen other places and it has just the right amount of flavor and kick, reminiscent of good home cooking. 

Definitely recommend if you're in the area.

Excellent service, delicious Thai cuisine, will definitely be back soon!  Great prices, extensive menu with some items not normally seen such as peanut curry which was delicious. Definitely a perfect lunch stop.

Decent Thai food, nothing to really write home about. Spice scale is 1-5, a three is a bit hotter than I've had elsewhere. Tom Kha soup is decent, the angel wing appetizer is tasty- ask for extra dipping sauce. Prices are fair, service is friendly. Takeout or lunch specials are the way to go.

The real deal. Amazing service (almost too amazing, slightly intrusive but not enough to reduce stars), cute weird interior, clean, professional, run with care. Great food with huge portions and totally reasonable prices! I bring a tupperware to take home leftovers. They'll add egg into anything to be cooked in, or will FRY ONE AND PUT IT ON TOP. Incredible. Good for vegans and meat eaters.

Looking for something to eat off the strip, came across this Thai place. Excellent food. Will not be disappointed. The wontons were freshly made. The spring rolls hot and crispy. Panang Curry lite and spicy. And don't forget, always get a Thai Ice Tea. Bon Apetite.
My new favorite lunch spot. Really close and convenient to UNLV. The food was amazing. The service was really fast and portions were really good. The orange chicken was so nice and tender.

Pretty MEH.

Did take out with this spot tonight. Got their Rangoons, jerky and spicy duck basil.

I have arrived home, and to my surprise, the rangoons are still somewhat crispy. They are creamy, and delicious. The sauce that comes with it is a little sweet... but it doesnt kill the taste of the filling.

The thai jerky didnt really have much flavor. I know its jerky... but it was pretty tough, dry and kind of flavorless. The sauce that came with it almost reminded me of a buffalo sauce....and almost made it worse.

Now, for my entrée. 

When i order something that has SPICY in its name.... i expect it to be....you know.... Spicy.

Nothing in this dish was spicy. I dont even think theres black pepper in the sauce....which tasted like soy sauce and maple syrup. The duck was kind of oddly cooked.... with some pieces being decently tender... and others feelings like i was chewing on a strand of yarn. 

Overall, if i had to do it again... i would just have a dinner of rangoons.

First time going there was already a great experience. I love this place! The food was definitely delicious,  the flavor is right on. Coming from Thailand myself, I would recommend Chao Thai to anybody who wants to enjoy real Thai food and not the americanized kind of Thai food like what most Thai restaurants usually serve. The servers are super friendly, the place itself looks very welcoming & Thai-like. I would definitely go eat there after class & probably bring my friends along because more people need to check them out! ^.^

This restaurant has a nice setting, but my dish wasn't that great. I asked my server to get me sriracha and he comes with a small plate of something that tasted like buffalo wing sauce. I told him I like my pad Thai spicy and he brought over a tray of spices. One of which I was looking for. Service could have been better but food could have been way better. No lunch specials on the weekends which SUCK.

This place is located in the back of a strip mall so it is easy to miss.  I am assuming their target market is UNLV a students.  The place is small and one table was 2 students cramming for a law test.  Another person on their iPad might have been a teacher.  My first thought was this would be a good spot to go get some work done- not a romantic dinner.

I ordered take out and did not eat it until the next day.
I ordered the red curry with tofu spicy 9.
It came out quickly and was wrapped well to avoid spillage.
I was very pleasantly surprised.
My mouth was tingly from the spices. They were not stingy on the tofu or the bamboo shoots and it came with a very generous amount of rice.
I will most certainly go back again.
Fantastic people working there and even better food. The pad Thai is spectacular and the corn fritters are the best I've had!!

Came in because my wife and I were craving pad thai. This place was above and beyond what I was hoping for. Service was phenomenal, I don't think my drink glass went below half full at any one time. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the food was sublime. The pad thai was flavorful and fresh, but the star for me was the tom kha. Slightly sweet and spicy with the perfect amount of acidity to cut through the creaminess of the base. If you are in town come here and you won't be disappointed!

Like all the others are saying, the waitress is a gem! Lunch specials are delicious, and the  mango sticky-rice is a gift from heaven.

I always order online to pick up since I work in the area, they always have it hot and ready for me by the time I get there.

The food is fresh and the lunch specials are cheap which is the plus side. The negative side is I ordered the basil chicken and their "medium" spicy is on a whole different level and trust me I love spicy food. But this was killing me I couldn't even bite into it I was practically just swallowing the food. I told the server this and she was like " oh sorry".  And on top of that they hardly put any chicken. Like 5%chicken and 95% beans.  my dish was practically overly spicy green beans and steamed rice. Not too sure if I would return.
Every time I come here I know I'm going to get a delicious meal :) I've never been disappointed here. Plus! It's right off of UNLV campus :)

Today my significant other and I were both getting over some nasty head colds, her while at work. So I decided we'd go out and eat some spicy Thai food to "sweat it out."

Chao Thai is a place we had eaten at before and have always been pleased with their food. This time, we ordered it as spicy as we could handle (a 4 on their 1-5 scale) and suffered through eating some of the greatest curry and Prik King either of us have ever had. Needless to say, we are both healed of our colds and satisfied now.

The service at this tiny restaurant are always some of the best. Super sweet people who take really good care of their customers. On this day in particular was when they are normally closed (oops we forgot to check their schedule online) but they decided to serve us nonetheless!

Love Chao Thai, would strongly recommend if you want to feel the burn - or just eat some good Thai food!
First time here and did a take out. Yellow curry was sooo good. Great portion and taste. Will be back again.

Wonderful food and excellent service. Though they were about to close, they allowed my friend and I to stay ! We had orange chicken and eggplant tofu. They adjusted our eggplant tofu and cooked it to  a mild spice. I had a wonderful experience !

Solid Thai spot with reasonable prices and great service! I've been here several times whenever I'm having that urging crave for Thai food! It's perfect how they're right across the street from UNLV and even more perfect how they offer lunch specials on weekdays til 3pm! Skip the long lines for gross SU food and just come here. So yummy :)

TOO MANY ONIONS! trying to save on the meat, I guess. Chicken in the pad thai was dry and old.The two other dishes were mongolian beef and spicy basil. Again, not enough of the dish you want to eat because of all the onions.

Really a great place to get punch between classes. Food comes out quick and is always delicious. Portions are generous and the prices are low. I find myself eating here two to three times per week even. It's better than almost every other Thai place I've been to in the vegas valley.

First time I've tried the Orange Chicken and I really enjoyed it! Although not as much as my usual Yellow Curry decision! I also had their Mango Smoothie with Boba, which was delicious. Best part though? Discovered they deliver! They were right on time and everything was fresh! It's perfect for students across the street from the restaurant at UNLV! Didn't have to move from my spot in Lied LIbrary. Minus going downstairs to get the food, of course

The food here is pretty good, the appetizers are excellent, the staff is very attentive and friendly (although english is a struggle for them) The Pad Thai is great but the curry is lacking. 

There's not a lot of space so lunch can be a challenge, Dinner is the perfect time to go. The lunch special is a very very good deal.

Check out the Mango and Sticky Rice dessert, texturally it's a bit strange to people not used to it, but once you overcome it it's absolutely amazing.

No real complaints, only accolades.

Excellent. Flavor = Authentic Thai Spice. Service = Great Hospitality. Cleanliness = Immaculate. Space = Intimate. Portion = Just Right. Price = Average. 

I really like this place. Always very good flavor. Very friendly. I just wish they were in a different location. Or maybe just add another. Not really complaining, I guess, I'll still come back but some of the other customers are rude to the workers here and I'm guessing that's because of the area. It's just uncomfortable to be around rude customers. Nothing against the establishment at all.

Located in a strip Mall, parking is easy to find.
Service was good, food even better. Best Pad Thai that I had had in awhile. I love Vegas food. I kick myself that I did not detour on the way home and bring some back with me.
For lunch they have several choices of combo plates for $6.95. Wow. This is a student zone, so great pricing to get the hungry people in, sell lots and keep the food fresh, always moving it out. The other dish we selected was the chow mein. Huge hit. You get won tons with each dish and either white rice or salad. I do not like dressing and they hit the salads hard with it, only complaint. Dressing should come on the side esp. when the food is ordered to go. It just drowned the lettuce badly BUT the portions of the main dishes were good and actually fed us twice.
I would drive out of my way when back in Vegas to order from here. Extra spicy = they listen! My noodles were fantastic.
Nice touch with the YELP sticker on the front door also. People's choice for Thai food!

Went here two weeks ago with my friend since we had a break from classes. I ordered the beef larb salad and my friend ordered the pad Thai. Both our dishes tasted awful and we didn't even finish it. Larb salad had way too much mint and the most disgusting after taste. I've had Thai food plenty of times, as well as authentic Thai food in Thailand. Maybe it was an off day ¯\_(?)_/¯.

The service here is excellent! The food is delicious and well priced. The staff is welcoming and quick to warn you if you may be ordering something too spicy. Our server was very knowledgeable of the menu and extremely kind. 

Come here for a bite to eat and you won't be disappointed. 

10/10
Great food!!! We always come here because the food is greatand super nice people!!! Spicy eggplant, tom yum, lomein, pad tai, seafood salad are my favorites

Great food, great place to hang out with friends.
Today is my friend's birthday, and the owner gave us a free dessert to celebrate with us ! Thank you so much ! 
Such a happy day !

After many weeks in Africa with no Asian food I've been on a tear since being back and was really craving Thai when I found this place for lunch. It's across the street from UNLV so they cater to students which is why you can get a nice dish for just $5.95 that will satisfy you. I got the Panang and Massuman Chicken Curries (admittedly gluttonous I know) and proceeded to scarf them down like the lions feeding on a Cape Buffalo I was watched the other day. Manners be damned. The taste was pretty good, especially for the price and I'm glad to have found this little Thai joint.

I've been going to this place for a while and it has never steered me away. I always get the red curry with seafood, chicken if I want to be cheap. The staff is so so, not too friendly, but not to a point to where you will never come back again. The prices are reasonable and the portions are plentiful. Also, it's at a very convenient location if you live near the strip. 

Sidenote: I did not know you can order your food on this app. That just puts icing on the cake. #geekmoment

This place has the BEST mixed veggies in town. The pad Thai and many other dishes are to die for. If you want it spicy just let them know and they'll kick it up even more than normal. 
The atmosphere is awesome, relaxing and quiet. The staff is extremely sweet and attentive, it's perfect in between classes!

This honestly is one of the worst Thai options in Las Vegas. I came in here one weekday for lunch and was one of three tables that had guests at it. The server seemed annoyed that I was there and approached the table and said "what would you like?" with no other greeting or so much as a smile on her face. I ordered a lunch combo with yellow chicken curry. The soup came out cold, like literally ice cold like it had been sitting in a refrigerator. The salad was drenched in a dressing that was way too sweet and my curry had four small pieces of chicken in and three small pieces of carrots, the rest (1/2 of the bowl) was onions. No potatoes at all despite the menu saying that there would be. I asked for the food to be medium in spice and it had no heat whatsoever. Overall very disappointing, I will not be back.

I enjoyed my second time at this place just as much as the first! 

I had the Yum Woon Sen and it had a light, fresh taste. The shrimp and calamari were very good. The glass noodles were very good. I didn't care for the parsley. It brought an unwelcome bitterness. However, that would not stop me from ordering the dish again. 

The service here is the gold standard for any restaurant!

As a student at UNLV, this restaurant is really convenient and affordable. Their chow mein is delicious and you can ask for extra spicy if you would like.Their tom yum soup is tasty too. Also ask for extra spicy if you would like. The lady who serves there is friendly as well. This is definitely my favorite spot !

Likes: 
- Delivery 
- Price
- Variety
- pretty good pad Thai 

Dislikes:
- I found the authenticity to be lacking 
- the basil chicken had more green beans than basil and really not that much chicken
- the mango sticky rice had barely any rice. Please don't tell me rice is expensive 
- the yellow curry was more brown (flavor was fine though)

Full disclosure : I'm half Thai and live in Los Angeles so I have a pretty good perspective on Thai food

Chao Thai is a nice Bangkok/American style Thai restaurant across the street from UNLV.  I took some time out of my day to give them a shot, and was not disappointed!

I ordered a Thai iced coffee, which was pretty good!  I would have liked it a tad bit stronger, but it was lightly sweet and creamy and had a nice rich coffee flavor.  Small glass, but good stuff.

For lunch I had the Duck Curry, which is a dish I often order at a lot of places.  Ive realized that most places don't do this dish very well, but Chao does a solid job at this one.  The curry is watery, as any good Bankok style curry should be, and packed a lot of flavor.  I ordered a 5/5, and the heat level was pretty solid as well. The duck had  touch of gristle to it, but other than that was a better quality than most Thai restaurants.  I think they might prepare the roast duck themselves, instead of buying it pre-prepared like a lot of Thai restaurants do.  The curry had pineapple, cherry tomatoes, red and green peppers, and basil.  All of the fruit and veggies tasted very fresh and juicy.  

Although the curry was just a touch on the sweet side, this dish surprised me.  I was impressed out their execution, and while the service isn't over the top, I would recommend this Thai restaurant to anyone in the area.

The lunch special is very tasty.  I had the pad thai dish, which included a side salad with I think miso dressing and an egg roll.  If you dine in, soup is included as well.  The owner was very nice -- I walked up to the counter and ordered on my lunch hour to go.  Not only did I receive the meal within 10 minutes during the heaviest 12-1pm lunch period, but the server brought me water while I was waiting.  Such a hidden place way in back of the shopping center, but it's a small and great find.
A small place, service was good and the food fantastic. I would definitely recommend this place to those who love Thai food.

Best Thai food in Las Vegas hands down. Duck curry is the best curry dish I have ever had. Papaya salad best in Vegas. Soups are to die for. Hidden location but well with the trip. Foodies must stop here to eat.

Soooo good!!! the stuffed chicken wings are a MUST! I just happened on this spot and out of the last 3 times I've been here the food is great! So far I've tried the noodles the curry and of course those angel wings!! The service is always very friendly and you can tell this is a family run business and I think that's the mom cooking away in the back. definitely go check it out.

Cute little restaurant right across from UNLV! I was a little skeptical to walking into this place, but the service and the food blew me away! Our waitress was extremely friendly and the food reminded me so much of my Thai friend's mother's food which I ABSOLUTELY LOVE! We had the Pad Thai with Chicken and the Sumana curry which is a coconut based curry that had chicken, carrots, and potatoes. I loved that they had the option to choose sticky rice or steamed rice and obviously we got both! I'm actually going back today to try it out with my boyfriend!! Super recommend it if you've never tried this place before and you love thai food! You won't be disappointed :)
Super duper bomb. I've tried the Panang and Pineapple curries, both with veggies and tofu, both so delicious. Service is really great also :)
Great Thai food for cheap!! Attentive service and delicious pad Thai, definitely recommend if you're hungry and want a quick bite in the area (:

I came tonight to try the volcanic calamari appetizer on the word of my fellow companion. It was a unique experience because it was both chewy and crunchy, breaded with chives. I didn't really taste any volcano, but I still loved the flavor. Maybe they considered the sweet and sour sauce the volcano.

I also tried another appetizer that was like an empanadas... And boy was that tastey. It had a juicy potato and meat filled center, with a peanut sauce I never bothered to use.

The service was on par, I had my water probably refilled fifty times. The staff was nice and did not seem upset that I had a lengthy visit due to getting lost in conversation. My last comment is that I was impressed how they split the bill.

The only reason why I give this place four stars is because of the pictures. I ordered coconut that ice cream and got a plate very different than what their picture had. I had a random chocolate whipped cream and the picture had nuts. The cream made the ice cream a little too sweet, versus what the expected peanuts would have provided.

I'll definitely be back to try a main course.

I'm going to start by saying that the flavor of the food was delicious.  I got Pad Se Ew, which is my Thai food go-to dish.  The broccoli was still crisp, just like I want.  The noodles were well cooked.  The seasoning was spot on.  There was a little more heat that I expected for a Se-Ew, but I'm not going to fault them for that because I didn't specify no heat.

I am going to echo the statements of many other posters.  The portion size left something to be desired.  Typically, I will eat about half of my portion from other restaurants and save the rest for another meal.  Here, I ate every single bite.  It was a smaller-square styrofoam box that wasn't particularly full.  For $10, they could afford to give me more noodles.  Along the same line, there wasn't a lot of meat in the box.  I didn't actually count, but I would guess that there were 15-ish small pieces of beef in the entire meal.  There were only six sticks of broccoli (I did count those because it seemed like so few).

So, I am on the fence.  The food is tasty and being right across from UNLV, it is convenient for my night classes... but I would have liked more bang for my buck.  Perhaps the $6 lunch price is more appropriate to the portion of food that you receive.  I'm still giving them the 4 stars because the food was tasty and the service was good.  I just would have liked more of it.
Kung pao good for price. Comes with rice. Ordered egg drop soup. Good meal for a under $20. Beef s little tough and could use a bit more beef.

I visited this location on a whim one day instead of walking into the Chipotle like I had planned. I'm vegan and kind of particular because of it. They were so nice and so accommodating! I wanted spring rolls with hoisin, and since they didn't have any hoisin sauce, they made two batches from scratch for me and gave me both choices! They also made the best vegan drunken noodles I've ever had, and they asked me if everything tasted the way I liked it after delivering each serving. I'll definitely be back.
Came here after class one day and wasn't expecting anything special. The food was delicious! The prices were reasonable and the dishes were a good size. The employees were friendly and attentive.

I come here a few times a month for lunch and I have to say that I have received some of the best customer service. 

The waitress is so kind, and hard working. She always remembers my meal and beverage preference, ALWAYS! Seriously, she could teach classes on good customer service.

The food is really good, and served fairly promptly. I go for the great customer service most of all.
Love this place. Reasonably priced and some real good Thai food. Plus it's right across UNLV, so location is perfect.

We followed the yelp app here and were very happy! Best cream cheese and crab Rangoon's I have ever had anywhere! Also had combination fried rice. Everything tasted so fresh. Very clean, very good service. Want to go back ASAP and try everything!

Ordered delivery. Pad Thai and Beef Panang Curry. Both level three spiciness?. Hands down best pad Thai I've ever had. Delicious flavors and saucy! The panang curry was the best we've had in a very long time!  You can tell when a restaurant uses quality ingredients!  The spiciness was perfect!  The food was hot and delivered on time. Highly recommend to anyone wanting Umami Thai food. One complaint. We ordered two entrees, and it only came with one container of rice. At least one rice for each entree should be standard.

I wanted to give this place 5 stars because their food is delicious and I love how you can make any dish super spicy. But the thing that makes me give them 3 stars is the service. Sometimes the food takes forever to come out and they can mess up your order. Beware of the eggroll given with the lunch special because it's a banana eggroll. I wasn't aware of this because they usually give other side dishes and ate it. I say beware because I'm allergic to bananas. Anyways. After the waitress asked me how spicy I wanted it, I answered with 3 out of 5. 3 is pretty spicy but after receiving my meal I found out that they did not add any spiciness at all. The waitress also forgot to make my Thai tea even though she stood behind the counter the whole time.

Overall, great food but service could be better.

This place is GREAT! The employees are super friendly and take care of customers quickly. Our food comes to us quick and never disappoints. Portion sizes are fair and prices are quite reasonable. 

If you're not sure what to order, try the Beef Pad See Ew and the Chicken Coconut Milk Soup, both "spicy level 2"; those are my go-to dishes . Order with a side of Fresh Spring Rolls and a Thai Tea..you're set to go!

Warning: will likely put you in a food coma; SO GOOD.

The Good:
I really love the flavor of the food in this place. My wife and I would order from them all the time.  We would always get the pad see ew, which is amazing! The crunchy pork with the chinese broccoli is also a favorite of ours.  It's also conveniently close to our apartment and my work.  So if we're craving some Thai food, I just order and pick up.  

Here's a tip, if you live in the vicinity, I suggest you just pick up, unless you're literally just around the corner.  If you order through their website or from eat24.com, even if you live less than 2 miles, they will still charge you $7 for delivery, since for some reason, there's some sort of glitch in the system and if you don't speak Thai, then explaining is not really an option. 

Dislikes:
I would say that there are just a few things I dislike about Chao Thai.  First is that for the price of their a la carte 6.95 and up, the quantity is not that much.  So if you're planning to feed more than 2-3 people on a couple of dishes, you may want to order extra.  Also, we went there tonight and ordered the Mongolian beef. Now, my wife and I LOVE Mongolian Beef and we order it at almost every Chinese restaurant we go to.  It's pretty much how we measure the quality of most Asian establishments that serves the dish (I know, WEIRD).  So we ordered the Mongolian beef and when we got the dish, there was literally, about 15 small pieces of beef and the rest was onions..............awwwkward.  So I asked the waiter and he said that's how it is.  WTF!? Seriously? I wanted to complain, but my wife was tired and told me to just let it go.  She was more upset about it because it's one of her favorites.  The flavor was really great, but the portion of the meat in the dish was HIGHLY disproportionate.  They should have called the dish ONION with a side of Beef............ RUDE! 

Lastly, we ordered from Chao Thai at my office not too long ago and one of my colleagues ordered the Pepper Steak lunch special.  Now, I'm not EINSTEIN or anything, but correct me if I'm wrong, when you hear STEAK, you know it's BEEF right?? Well, I called and asked why it's an extra $1.00 for the beef option?  And yes, when you order online, they ask you if you want chicken, pork, tofu or beef for an extra $1.  Here's my problem with this.  First of all, the dish is PEPPER S-T-E-A-K.  Meaning.......beef is already implied in the dish.  So why not just charge $1 more......  no, they actually give you an option and charge you a $1 more for what the dish is SUPPOSED to come with.  It's not a big deal, but when I called and inquired, the lady I spoke to said, "beef cost more, that's why it's a dollar extra."  Uhm, I didn't ask for an economic lecture, Lady! She also said, "Nobody has ever complained before." Again.......... WTF? Maybe no one has ever ordered online and got the $1 extra option!! I didn't want our food to be spat on so I just said, fine, just deliver it! 

I would give them an extra star if they stop being so DAMN CHEAP about they meat!!!!! Damn!!!!! 

THE END.
The food was amazing and the service was fantastic! The lady at the front was sooo friendly and helpful! I will definitely come back.

Okay I need to update my review because I can't hate on a restaurant just because their food is so spicy I can't feel my mouth afterwards. In fact I actually love this about Chao Thai and I'm going to be visiting more often I think. The other main reason to go to Chao Thai over other options in the area is this: Green Curry Fried Rice. I've never seen it offered anywhere else and I guarantee that it alone is worth a try. It has all the flavors of a green curry wrapped up in a fried rice without all the soupy mess. It's almost like the spices get soaked up by the rice and it makes the dish hotter. The level 4 (out of 5) was making me sweat but it wasn't so hot I couldn't keep eating. We also ordered the tofu pad see ew and chicken panang curry. Both were good, but the tofu in the pad see ew was bland and the pieces of tofu were larger than one bite. Honestly nothing else matters but the green curry fried rice. Come here, get that, and anything else you order will be just fine. Just watch your spicy levels.

This is by far my favorite Thai restaurant!!!! There yellow curry is amazing; the seafood, chicken & the duck one are the best the duck one also comes with veggies! OMG & the Thai tea love it! They always make sure your cup is full! Excellent customer service, there always a good vibe when we go! The papaya salad is perfect! For dessert we always get the sticky rice and mango mmmmm!!!!!!!
Seriously best pad Thai I have had. Great portion noodles are perfect and flavor is fire. Also it's a super cute place. Service is top notch too. Go here!!! So yummmmmmm

What a great place. We ordered the hell out of a lunch for four with like eight dishes. Everything was fresh and seasoned perfectly. Portion sizes were good and all the dishes had very distinct flavor profiles. Good food and very reasonable as well.

after a long day at a convention we were craving Thai food. I checked yelp for some ideas and pick the place that let me order take out through yelp. Super simple to order. We pulled up popped and got our food got back in the car and we were off. 

We got pad Thai, green curry, and a chicken spicy basil dish. Everything was super tasty and we enjoyed the meal very much. The dishes were reasonably priced which was one of the reasons that we selected this restaurant. 

All in all a great experience.

Food was okay. Typical thai food. My lemonade was too sweet to drink, I was disappointed. The service was okay but I felt rushed. The lady even moved my boyfriend's fork to take his plate, when he wasn't finished. Not that impressed.

My boyfriend and I stop in during the week at UNLV. Their lunch special is very cheap for what you get. I love the miso soup and the honey mustard dressing with the salad. My favorite Thai food (and pretty much the only thing I have ever tried) is Pad Thai, so I always get it. It hits the spot and fills me up. I don't realyl care for the little fried food that comes with the meal; it just doesn't hit the spot. the service was really spot on though.

This little restaurant is wonderful! It's great for students who want a cheap but filling meal, and it's even better if you have a predilection for spicy foods! I love getting the spice level 5, but be warned, it'll burn. There is also a large variety of non spicy foods, traditional Thai dishes that come in good portion sizes. The real deal here, however, is their lunch special from 11 am to 3 pm. It comes with soup, salad, and your choice of entree. The waitresses are always nice and accommodating, and they serve milk tea here as well. Service is fast, so if you're looking for quick Thai cuisine in between classes, this is your place to go.

Very good food, service and a nice lunch special. 

I love Thai food so I've eaten at many places both here and where I'm from, NY. So I always look for freshness. This wasn't as fresh as I'm used to, but it was still very good. It was more of what I expect, than what I've been surprised with. 

But seriously, their customer service was amazing and everyone was so kind! 

I had the pad Thai lunch. (Basic I know)

We have ordered many times from here and was very pleased with their food. However, their customer service is terrible. They will not work with you to resolve any issues but makes excuses. They charged us $4 delivery fee last week, today they charged $5 for delivery and to the same office. I asked why the delivery fee is not disclosed on their menu and of course, they couldn't explain and didn't offer to refund it either. I asked what determined the different fee and again, the reason was not acceptable or did it make any sense. Just because their food is good... with TERRIBLE customer service, the food is just as TERRIBLE!! I don't recommend this place at all!!

The food is ok, and a very decent price. The service is horrible. I walked in and the lady yelled at me from the register for here or to go? The entire restaurant kind of turned and looked my way, a little embarrassing. It's convenient and cheap but definitely not fast service. They take forever!
Great food, great prices! Tried their Singapore noodles and glass noodles - delicious! Chicken and beef satay is also great. The Thai tea is a bit too sweet, but still good.

OMG AMAZING!!! I love thai food but the is by far the best thai food I've had!!! We ordered the orange chicken and shrimp fried rice. it hard to explain how god it was...the orange chicken was cooked perfectly, very light and bready with just the right amount of sauce. Sometimes the chicken can be too chewy and the sauce stuck on it  this was everything but that! The pineapple friend rice had shrimp and chicken in it. Once again it was light now heavy and very satisfying. Even the lemonade was good and sweet! I'll be sure to come here the next time I'm on town

I am always looking for a good Thai place that delivers to my house because I'm fat, picky and lazy.

I think I have found a winner!

When evaluating Thai places, I use my standard order Pad Thai, Prik King and some curry (mostly red or yellow, panang if I'm feeling frisky, never duck always a disappointment).  Bottom line up front:  its good, not great, obviously cheap but flavorful.

How can a Thai place screw up Pad Thai?!  Try Weera and you'll see (FYI weera is the exact opposite of this place, huge portions, terrible flavor)!  This was very good Pad Thai, the flavor was slightly sweet and tangy....perfect.  Chicken was pretty dry and minimal but that is a common thread in all of their dishes.

Prik King is like a spicy flavor explosion in your mouth.  Even if you don't like green beans, try it!  The only problem with their Prik King is the lack of fresh lime leaves.  The lime leaves give it a citrusy pop that combats the powerful red curry base.  The dried leaves they use aren't a very good substitute.  However the dish is still delicious and well composed.  However finding meat was like hunting through a red swamp of deliciousness.

I went with the red curry this time.  Oh so flavorful and tasty!  Again not generously meaty but the spice level and depth of flavor were spot on!  The bamboo shoots weren't the freshest.

And for an appetizer we went with the fried wontons.  Save your money!  There was about a penny sized meat mixture in each dollar bill sized wonton.  The dipping sauce was spot on though.

So the moral of the story is, Chao Thai will cut corners on you (minimal meat and/or fillings) but the flavors are spot on!  I'm so lazy that I will tolerate their less than filling fillings for good taste and a delivery boy.
The real fruit smoothies are made with powder not that good and soup was kinda unusual but the curry was on point and the salad was yummy
Great food. Very good service amd very large portions. The tea selections are very tasty and sweet. The waitress and polite and nice. Very authentic and delicious.
The food was very tasty and very authentic.  I would definitely come back.  The mango boba tea was perfect!  Thank you for a great meal.  The service is also very friendly and prompt.

Three of my classmates and I went here for lunch one day after school. From earlier that week, they said they had really good food and the owner changed. I went in and I thought "Hey this place looks better now" and I started to believe my friends. The menu was reasonably priced, especially their lunch special. However, their customer service ruined my experienced. After we sat down and ordered, 10 minutes later this large group of people came in. The waitress had asked us to move to another table (its not like we had a choice) so the larger group coulld sit together and we moved quietly. This was strike number one. I've been to restaurants throughout the valley and I've never been asked to move for a group of people who did not make a reservation and came after us. If this was the case, then the waitress should be seating people instead. Personally, that group should have divided themselves if they couldn't fit within two tables. Anyways, strike number two: my friend ordered a pad thai 3 with beef and I ordered pad thai 2 with chicken. On a scale of 5, I can't handle a level 3. When our orders came out, the waitress couldn't differentiate between chicken  pad thai and beef pad thai and didn't know which dish had spicy level 2 or 3. She just assumed which dish was which and handed it to us. She did nothing to double check she gave us the right dish nor was she friendly or apologetic. Strike three: The pad thai was extremely disappointing. It is probably one of the worst ones i've ever had. I don't understand how you can mess it up. The noodles were slightly soggy, the flavor was barely there, and I could taste the spice more than I could than the traditional flavor that should be in a pad thai. Needless to say, I don't intend on coming back until they change their customer service. I would rather pay the price and drive some where farther for a knowledgable staff and consistently great food. The only reason why I am giving it a two star is because the prices are reasonable and I am hoping for future improvements.
Food was mediocre at best. Ordered the chicken chow mein and the portion was so small it was ridiculous

Excellent customer service, great prices and delicious food. Came here for lunch and they have a pretty great lunch special until 3:00pm. I ordered the curry with chicken. They ask for spice level 1-5. I ordered 4 and it wasn't even spicy to me but I'm strange I love it really really hot so if that's you order level 5. My lunch special came with soup, egg roll and a very large portion of chicken curry. The curry was full of flavor and the chicken was seasoned well. Sometimes the chicken seems to be flavorless but this wasn't the case. Everything in the dish was cooked to perfection. The soup was very very good. It was like a chicken broth that had a little cabbage in it. I'm not sure what it was but I would surely eat it again. The spring roll / egg roll was crisped perfectly and it was lighted covered with a sweet sauce. The service was quick and I will be coming back.

Very nice little place. Friendly staff. We went for lunch, ordered off the lunch special menu. My girlfriend got the broccoli beef, I got the chicken chili. The waiter asked me how spicy from 1-5, I said 3, could probably have gone 4-5 but that's just me, I like it hot. Regardless, the chicken was tender and wonderfully flavored, the peppers were al dente, the egg roll came with what tasted like a mango based dipping sauce, very mild, slightly sweet and not to overpowering. It came with a small bowl of soup - a very nicely flavored hot and sour type broth with big chunks of veggies.

Good service, great food. I'll definitely come back.

Had lunch here with my family while visiting Las Vegas. A small restaurant but the food was delicious. 

We ordered the pad Thai, panang curry, beef salad, papaya salad, larb & seafood soup. I liked everything except the soup. The food was reasonably priced except the $5 rice charge. Still would recommend to try if near by! Enjoy.

We were in las vegas for a vacation and happened to try this restaurant after reading those good reviews. 

The waitress was so friendly, she explained everything clearly and very attentive through out our dining.

We ordered Cashew Chicken, Red Curry with chicken, Veg Fried Rice, Spicy Basil Fried Chicken, Kung Pao Chicken and Sticky rice. Everything comes with spicy level 3 unless we specify spice level(not spicy). All curries came with a cup of rice. 

Red Curry was little sweet to me and had more liquid curry, Cashew Chicken was good, Veg Fried rice was good with good amount of vegetables.SpicyBasil Fried Chicken was a minced chicken curry. 
 
Food: 4
Service: 5
Ambience: 3.5

Tried this place bc it had high reviews and was near the area. I purchased the Chicken Pad Thai, Pineapple Fried Rice, and fried wontons. The Pad Thai was like any other pad thai, delicious with a huge portion at a good price. The Pineapple Fried Rice was also tasty and good for the price. The Fried Wontons were pretty good; just like eating a regular old deep fried wonton wrapper with a little bit of stuffing. Overall, I can't complain for the price but I feel like the Thai Style Noodle in Summerlin is a bit cheaper and more tastier than this place. But still yummy and affordable.
The Crab fried rice is really good. I was hoping it would be spicy but it's still delicious. A MUST try.

Food was delicious! I ordered the Yellow Curry lunch special which came with white rice, an egg roll, soup and salad. I loved it all, the soup was ok not much flavor but the salad and everything else awesome. I was thrilled that when my bill came it was $8.00 with tax, I did order a diet coke too. Awesome Lunch!

Was referred by a friend to give this place a try.  Quaint restaurant and very clean.  The staff was extremely nice and very attentive.   I had the lunch special which turned out to be a lot of food!  And it was very tasty.

Starting with drinks and then apps and entrees, everything was scrumptious!!!!! We had coconut bobs and Thai iced tea and Thai iced coffee, awesome! Fresh rolls were bomb and then pineapple fried rice not spicy and pork pad thai spicy 5. Great combination and completely satisfying!!

I had a quick lunch here after getting a mani pedi next door. The restaurant was clean, food was great, and the one thing that stood out from the rest was the service. The server was friendly and attentive. I needed a cab to go back to my hotel and waited 40+ min and no cab had been arranged. So she overheard me talking to the operator n offered a ride to go back to my hotel. I paid for the ride, and it was less than what I would've paid for a cab. They went above and beyond and really helped me out that day. I'll definitely be back to visit n eat.

STUDENTS if you like thai food that's cheap and decently good go here! it's not totally amazing, but for $6.95 lunch specials, it's one of the best meals across UNLV.

Lunch specials (10:30am - 3:00pm Mon-Fri):
-Small soup, salad, and appetizer of the day (soup and salad weren't tasty, very bland)
-Medium size entree w/ rice

FOOD 3/5:
-Panang Curry (Comes w/ lunch special): Pretty good, just wish they had more veggies in it
-Mango with sticky rice ($5.95): Very good, no complaints here

SERVICE 5/5:
-The lady with glasses usually serves, and she was very attentive. She always refilled my drink and checked up on me!

Went here with a coworker for their lunch special. I got Lo Mein, it was good, a bit oil but good. They have really redone the inside and many people were coming for takeout. The food was hot and fresh and the lunch specials were priced right! I really liked the tang dressing on the salad. I would come back!

A nice cheap alternative to restaurants on the strip. Overall some of the flavors are extra sweet, probably to make the flavors more palatable, but good.

Pricing is pretty reasonable, or cheap relative to the strip. Service was ok, and the food made fresh. Portion sizes were excellent and we all left very full having ordered just one entree a piece and no apps.

Affordable, great value, fresh and Hot!
Just a few words I can use to describe this place. I ordered online for delivery and had the food here piping hot (and spicy hot) within 30 minutes. Okay I do live about a mile away from the place and was just too damn lazy to get up and go there. I had a delicious Tom-Yum soup with shrimp, and they did not scrimp the shrimp! There were at least 8 full perfectly cooked shrimp in the serving, just spicy enough. I followed the soup with one of the favorites "Spicy Basil" combination meat, again lots of great beef and shrimp! I ordered the the spice level at level 3"Spicy" (there is also mild, medium and HOT). Perfect! Broke a nice sweat on the forehead and sniffles (a sign of good spice). Bottom line for decent, good tasting food this is the place.

I enjoy their pad thai. I like that it is not dry like some places. Noodles are always moist. Their lunch special items are filling and I would recommend it! You can't beat their lunch special prices. Drunken noodles is my new favorite dish! This dish has already chili sauce in it, however you can add a level 2 spicy for that extra kick. Service is always on point!

Great lunch specials and great food. I've only ordered take-away and delivery, but the service is always on point. I love the fresh rolls and the curries are wonderfully flavorful and loaded with fresh, crisp veggies.

I've been having lunch here from time to time for over three years now. The food has always been good, but they always seem disorganized.  Today was moderately busy, 7 or 8 other diners when I got there, and it took forever to get my order. After 20 minutes I had to ask to waitress to make my order to go. And they didn't give me the rice I ordered. I don't think they charged me, but I'm not sure, because they kept the receipt. So I can't recommend them if you have a time limit, unless you order ahead.

Well.. 

I will start with the food. I haven't been disappointed with the flavors. Everything has been good. Portions are a bit small as many others have mentioned. My main issue comes from the 1st and second time I ordered food via delivery rather than going into the restaurant itself. The first time they delivered, it was a $2 delivery charge. They are literally 2 miles away from my apartment. 6 minute drive. The second time, without notice.. the delivery fee jumped to $7. A significant increase. 

I really liked the food enough to order food from them.. Unfortunately, It's enough to never order delivery from them again - with that steep delivery charge.  Doesn't seem worth it. I'd rather drive there.. but it seems a bit shady, so I'm not feeling good about supporting them again. Sounds petty, but it's the principle of the matter I suppose. 

So if you want to give it a try, head over and do not order delivery, unless you don't mind the fee.  Happy eating!

When your boss asks you to find a place for lunch and then tells you its your fault if the food is bad, you get nervous. Lucky for me Chao Thai was impressive. The three of us (boss, co-worker and myself) were greeted and seated immediately. We each asked for water to drink and were asked if we wanted lemon in our water. I'm quite sure we were brought water with lime though. No matter. It was still refreshing. 

In the mean time, we each turned directly to the lunch menu. My boss knew already that she wanted chicken pad thai. My co-worker went with panang pork at a spice level 1. I went with panang chicken at a spice level 2. A few moments after we ordered we were brought our first round of food, vegetable soup. Mostly it was broth with cabbage, cilantro and lemon grass. It had a strong ginger bite and a little sour note. My boss couldn't eat it because of the spice of the ginger. My co-worker ate it but said it cleared her sinuses. It made my lips tingle. Not a bad soup but not my favorite.

Soon after we had finished our soups our lunches were dedelivered. We each started with the spring roll on the side. It was perfectly crisp and flaky but not overly greasy. The vegetables and glass noodles rolled within were perfect. Two out of three in our party agreed. The third said she wanted meat in it rather than vegetables. Her preference. My bosses pad thai looked delicious and she confirmed my guess. The panang was just about euphoric as a good curry should be. The pungent curry spice. The sweet rich coconut. It creats a heavenly blend that has a way of putting my soul at ease. This version has bell pepper and green beans. The green beans were an interesting touch I had not experienced in a panang before. Not a bad addition but wholey unexpected. Much like the serrano or jalepeno pepper I got a bite of thinking it was a green bean. I bit into something more crisp and my mouth lit up. I could feel it on my tongue, in my throat and in my nose. It made me cough, sweat and drool. Now, as my co-worker before me, my sinuses were clearing. The burn went away in short order. 

The food was grand and the service excellent. The prices are a fair $6.95 for a filling lunch. The staff is friendly and attentive even telling my boss she had dropped her napkin and bringing her a new one. I'm glad I don't work or live closer because I would be in way too frequently.

This restaurant is located in the university area, right across from Chipotle, sitting towards the back of the parking.

When I try out new Thai place I usually go w/ the REGULAR: PAD THAI! If you can not cook a decent order of Pad Thai, I'm cool on trying anything else on your menu.  That's Taco Bell f'n up your tacos and that's what they are known for...smh LUDICROUS 

FYI: no UNLV discount  is given. So if you all up in yo' feelings about them not giving a discount, take yo' ass back across the street to the COMMONS or STU. UNION.

Ok, so I ordered the REGULAR w/ tofu, spice level 3 (spice levels are 1-5), spring roll and endamame.

PAD THAI: I'll give them the GREEN light, it was good, spice level 3 was a tad bit spicier than I expected.  It was killing my palet, its a slow burn, once it hit the back of my tongue my entire mouth was on fire.  Huge pieces of tofu, just right not tough and overcooked nor was it "juicey" and under cooked, perfect balance.  It absorbed all the flavors of the pad thai, not over saturated.  Bean sprouts, carrots and chopped peanuts are served on the side

SPRING ROLL: Nice crisp, it does not leave you with greasy fingers and tips.

EDAMAME: um yea, this is where I was like "I could've opted out on these right here" Blanched in water and served. Because I ordered my food to go, at home I was able to spruce up and the flavor the endamame to my liking.

Will i go back to the place: YES
It's on the way home from work and it's good, on a scale of 1-10, I'll give them a 7.5. Next time I go back I think I might try their Tom - Kha or the Curry.

Super nice staff, cute little place, a place where you can take a small group and get A LOT of food for a little price.  My order can feed two and have some leftover for the next day.  But this is just my opinion, try it out and see what your take is on it...

TIP FOR THE STUDENT(S) ON A BUDGET:
Now if you're that student on a budget, you can definitely split an 1 entree and 2 appetizers between 4ppl and have change leftover.  Now with your change, whomever in the group that has the 64oz cup from 7-11 and refill for $1.07 and split the remaining $0.33 between the 4 of you.  All you gotta do is put $5 on it.

Ridiculously small portion size. Too much oil. Lots of white rice.

Would far prefer to pay another dollar and get a real lunch.

Coconut and Taro boba!!

Seriously they make the best here! So delicious and sweet! I love it! The real reason to come here is the Pad Thai though! Oh yeah, and Patti! She's AMAZING! She remembers my order, from day one! And I don't go there every week! She constantly has my water filled, and even takes a few mins to talk to me and crack jokes. The drink I order comes out to $4 and the Pad Thai lunch is 6.95! The prices are perfect here for lunch! You get a lot of food for a little money, honey!

The pad thai is delicious! I always get a level 3, sans peanuts or carrots. The lunch special comes with a soup, and like a deep fried won ton skin, so good! 

I also tried the chow mein, and it was pretty solid. The one thing I like is that you don't leave feeling like a fat Buddha! And, they give you enough, where you can take some home with you!

Come for the lunch special and boba!!

Yass!
This is one of my favorite places! Owners are great. They always remember us and know our order! Very very good food. Everything I have tried has been awesome.

Had to review this place again. Been going here very often and it's an awesome choice to make for lunch off campus. I love their lunch speicals and they have a wide range of options. I have had very good experiences here. I would very much  recommend!

Pretty affordable Thai food conveniently located across the street from UNLV. Lunch specials under $7 (for tofu or chicken. beef or seafood is extra) include a bowl of their soup, which is usually something similar to an egg-drop soup with pasta in it. Not the best but it's nice and warm..... Sometimes. Also comes with a small salad before your meal with a delicious dressing- I wish I knew what this was! It's white, thick, and tastes peanutty/gingery. 
I will usually get the pad Thai and that's good (not the best but good). Delicious drunken noodles. 
 BE WARNED- their foods are SPICY! Even a level two will sometimes leave me sweating. 
Give yourself plenty of time for lunch as service is somewhat slow.

I'm going to be honest . I didn't like the spring rolls.  Maybe because I am used to the amazing spring rolls from Mr. Sandwich which is a totally different type though.  Thai vs Vietnamese. The pad woo sen was decent enough. Pretty quick for lunch service.

The Thai food here is delicious! I've been coming here since I first discovered it last year, and it's always been great. But what has me coming back over and over again is the excellent customer service! It's always the little details that make us customers happy and keep us coming back :)

I am really picky about Thai places, maybe not as much so as Dan P., but this probably is a 3.5 star joint - bumping it up because the prices are right, service is friendly, and the makeover from its old space really makes a difference.

There are a wide range of lunch special choices for $5.99!  The Thai iced tea is really good and cheap too.  The salad dressing is a bit iffy but they have different soups each day of the week for lunch, and the lunch special includes soup, salad, and vegetarian eggroll.

I have been to Chao 3 times for lunch - once ordering the chicken chili, once for the spicy basil eggplant, and once for the beef satay.  Overall, everything has been decent.  You get a choice of chicken, beef, pork or tofu unless the meat is already specified.  There are 2 noodle dishes on the lunch menu as well.

What I have discovered is that the peanut sauce is really delicious.  Yesterday I ordered the beef satay lunch special - so we started with egg drop soup and basic salad.  Then, I received a beautiful plate (see photo) - it had 4 skewers of marinated beef which tasted great on their own but the peanut sauce elevated them, a mini cucumber-red onion salad, white steamed rice, and an eggroll with sweet dipping sauce.

This was plenty of food for the price and my friend eating with me decided she will definitely order beef satay next time.  For an affordable lunch and good service, stop in here.
Great food and VERY cheap!  Had the lunch size pad thai with chicken and was delish!   Also- very nice people and had good sense of humor which counts for a lot!

I think this is the best Thai food I've ever had. I'm from LA and am so glad I used yelp to find dinner. Great service, food, and price. What more could you want? We ordered pad see eww, pineapple fried rice and one of the noodle soup. Each was delicious. Wish I lived closer!!

Overall a great place to eat & very budget friendly with their lunch special. I had their garlic pork lunch special & their entrées are well proportioned in my opinion since I get full once I finish up my plate. It's also convenient to have a Thai place across from UNLV especially if you don't want to spend so much money from the SU.

Kind of disappointed to be honest . I paid $12 for a Thai tea and yellow curry lunch special...so basically I paid extra for half the curry and a piece of lettuce they said was salad. Don't get me wrong it tasted all right but the lunch specials are a rip off

Totally recommend this place! Have been hesitant about ordering Thai/ Chinese,  have had way to many bad experiences.  It was our first time trying it out, it definitely exceeded our expectations.  Ordered the marinated steak salad, it was light, refreshing, excellent flavor. The prik king was spicy,  but not to bad.  I did mild with chicken. Check this place out! You won't be disappointed!!

I came for dinner alone and got to people watch a bit. I noticed the people dining in had some great conversations over delicious food. And there were SO many who picked up to go orders that seemed to be regulars, which makes you realize this place has got to be good if its their go to choice. 
Thai food is usually family style, and they only offer combo plates during lunch time. Unfortunate for a solo diner, so I settled on the eggplant dish which came with rice. It tasted ok, but I was expecting the egg plants to be more cooked down to that brown color. Curious about desserts? Be sure to ask if the mangos are in season! I was prepared to leave room for some mango sticky rice, but overheard that they were out of season..  bummer.

Love love love this place I never tried Thai food before and this place the first Thai place I went to. It's amazing plus it's walking distant from school. They have  a lunch special from 11-3 and I recommend getting the cashew chicken or the pepper chicken it's delicious. Be careful with how hot you get it though it can get very spicy. Prices are moderate.

I grew up in Bangkok, Thailand so I'm very picky when it comes to eating "Thai" food here in the United States! However, I knew this place was going to be authentic and delicious when I walked in and the two ladies behind the counter were speaking Thai. Yes!!

I ordered through Yelp (which was fast and easy) so my order was ready when I showed up at the restaurant (about 10-15 minutes later). I was disappointed that you have to pay with cash (or incur a small charge for using your card on purchases less than $15) but that is my only complaint. The ladies behind the counter were friendly and very pleased when I thanked them in Thai! 

The food itself was delicious. I ordered the pad see ew with a medium spicy level(expecting the American version of spicy) but boy, they delivered on the spiciness, flavor, and authenticity! For a little less than $10 I received a heaping pile of stir-fried noodles, celery, large pieces of chicken, and napkins on the side. 

I recommend ordering to go from this location (it's pretty small and a little dark inside). I know I'll be getting my Thai fix from here from now on!
Heavy handed. Oilly. Green chicken curry mushy and soupy. Chicken spicy basil was ground chicken (I think). Drunken noodles bland and clumpy.

It was a pleasure visiting this hidden gem for the first time. I've been all over Yelp looking for a Thai spot near my job that I can visit on my lunch break. I went in today at 11:15am, there were only a few people dining. I was greeted and seated the moment I walked in. My order was taken literally within 1 minute of my arrival. My soup and salad were brought to me immediately and the Pad Thai I ordered was brought out before I even finished my soup! All of this made me very happy being that I have a short lunch break. The chicken Pad Thai (spicy level 4/5) was on point! Full of flavor and fresh. The noodles didn't stick together like at other places, and was saucy enough (I usually have to ask places for extra sauce)...I was nervous about the chicken because most places cook it too long and it ends up way too chewy. Not here. The chicken was tender and wonderful. The server was attentive the entire time, kept checking on me to make sure I didn't need anything. I don't have a single complaint. I look forward to coming back to try other items on the menu.

We love this place, every time we are in Vegas we stop. The prices are good and everything is always fresh. We have loved everything we've gotten here: Tom Kai Kai, fresh spring rolls, sesame chicken, curry's, cashew chicken etc.

I wouldn't call myself a "Thai food connoisseur", but I've definitely had my fair share of good and bad Thai food. This place is so good and have never been disappointed. My go to Thai around here! Check out their lunch special, best deal!
Great Thai food! I love the Tom Kah soup. They have fantastic pad Thai. The service is great and friendly.

Food = 3*
Service = 3.5*

Had the chicken panang lunch special, taste was good but thought there was only a small amount of meat (as stated in other reviews). Curry seemed more oily than other Thai places I've been. Also had the Thai beef jerky and was disappointed, meat was dry and was served with a buffalo sauce which I thought was an odd pairing. Overall the service was good, food was relatively quick and the staff was very nice. Restaurant is very clean and located next to UNLV. Overall I'd rate my experience as a 3.5/5

Wife and I went in for lunch today because I talked so much about it.  Well, from the last time I came in, the lunch special went up to $6.95 and did not include a "dessert" (like fruit the last time.)  Hence the four star.  If it was still $5.95, definitely a 5 star because of the value.  The portions are very decent, and you get soup and a cold salad.  I love cold salad.  I can't stand when your salad if warm or wilty (yuck.)  I am not one for cream type dressing but the one here is good.  I order the basil chicken at a 3.  Last time I had a 5 and couldn't feel my mouth (but it was sooooooooo good that it didn't matter.)  My wife ordered the pad thai no spice.  When hers arrived, she had a bite and noticed that it was spicy.  We grabbed the waitress and she took it back immediately.  Within minutes, another dish arrived and was perfect.  Now to be honest, I have had tastier Thai food, however, I do enjoy this food also.  We would definitely come back and recommend it to all.  Remember, it's $6.95...where can you get a deal like that?

I ate everything and did not take any pictures. But let me share with you that the service here is an A++. Our server was so courteous and attentive. She said "thank you" every time she removed an empty plate from the table. She gave us more water before we asked. She checked on us to make sure that everything was fine. When another customer gave her a few cents as tips, she politely and appreciatively said thanks. 

The place is clean, relatively high ceilings. There is no wifi.

The food tasted good. I especially liked the sauce for cashew shrimp. The vegetables were crisp and fresh. Also ordered egg rolls, papaya salad, green curry, drunken noodles. Tasty!

Great place for lunch. Reasonably priced.  
The staff is friendly.  Orders are ready in a reasonable
Amount of time .
 Food is great too

I really enjoyed the food here especially how they have a 5 dollar lunch special and the portion they give is more than what you pay for. If it's your first time trying Thai Food I suggest telling your waiter/waitress your desired level of spiciness which is a scale of 1 being a tinge spicy and 10 being really spicy. Dishes that may be applicable to this is Pad Thai noodles and a lot of curry dishes. This place is also convenient for me because I'm a college student and the walk to campus here is a easy way go.

The best Thai food I've ever had 
I stumbled across this place during a recent visit from Los Angeles and boy am I glad 
The fresh rolls were ok but the pineapple curry was really really special as was the spicy basil and the best Thai iced tea ever 

I'll DEFINITELY be back next time I'm in Vegas

I wish they delivered to Los Angeles
Very good food for a very cheap price! The server is super friendly. He can speak Vietnamese as well. What a surprise. We came here every single day on our trip.

Such an amazing place! I've been here a few times before but this visit made me write a review! It's such a cute restaurant located by UNLV. They have good 6.95$ lunch specials, curry, and orange chicken to die for. Their Thai tea is also super amazing and flavorful. As for service, it was great! Didn't have to ask for water since it was always checked on and I got in and out on a busy Monday at 1130-1215. I recommend this place for any broke college student or anyone looking for a quick, and quality bite to eat if you're feelin Thai.

Really good food... Made fresh to order and with fresh ingredients!
Super nice brother and sister team!
Highly recommend it!

This has to be one of the best Thai restaurant's I've experienced in Vegas. They have it all; decent pricing, great food, and friendly, fast service.
I come here quite frequently with my boyfriend, and we are addicted to the cream cheese ragoons that they serve. We've tried just about every curry they have to offer.
