Panang, Red, Green, Pumpkin, and Pineapple are all delicious and I have trouble deciding which one is my fav. The Pad Thai here is also great, and so is the Kung Pao dish.
The spicy scale is on 1-5 and it is SPICY. It's probably just because I'm white and can't handle spice for shit,but I really can't get anything over a 3 here. Which is ok cause I can build it up right? Right? Challenge accepted.
You can either dine in or do take out, both ways you'll get your food fast. the ladies that work here are so nice and it's actually fun coming into this restaurant.

First off I wanna say the girl server is amazing very attentive then the food also perfect I got the green curry with chicken and shrimp and it was amazing !! Def on of my favorite places for Thai food spice numbers was on point also

My first time! I ordered the Chicken Yellow Curry (extra veggies) and the Beef Pad See Ew (extra egg) for delivery. Wanted to add extra veggies including broccoli, peppers, & onions to the order however there was NO button for this request on Yelp (This is the case with many restaurants- reason for 4 stars). I left a request in the notes, knowing there would probably be an extra charge. I received a call from the restaurant asking about exactly what I wanted and he explained that there would be an extra charge. He wanted to make sure I was ok with it. I just needed to give the delivery person $2 cash for the extra veggies, and $1 cash for the extra egg. Next time I will know to have cash ready and to put it in the notes so it will be a smooth transaction. The food was EXCELLENT! Friendly service, followed instructions, and timely delivery. Will order again. I hope it's consistent. Fingers crossed. :)
Great Thai restaurant. I recommend the lunch specials.
The amount and quality of the food you get for the $6 lunch special earns this place 5 stars for me.
Good food but very slow service. Ordered pad see ew and took an hour for me to get my food. Only one party ahead of us.
Ordered Chow Mein with no sprouts to go. Watched it be written down. Got back to work just to find out that most of my chow mein was covered in sprouts.

I ordered $40 worth of food from these people, they bring my food and when I open my bag I realized they didn't put any condiments in my bag, which I realized in five mins. As soon as I notice that I called them and they said ok he will bring it. I call back again they hung up in my face, about probably five times. They finally answer and said I have to pay $4 for the soy sauce after I just gave them $40 and a tip so now I have to give $4 more dollars for your mistake. When they finally come back I open the door and I told him I didn't need it anymore now, me thinking they weren't going to come because of how long They took. As I'm closing my door he says you wasted my time "fuck you bitch". I then opened my door and was ask "what did you just say to me", and before I could even fully get my question out he threw the soy sauce at me and it went all over my front door step and all over me. He runs down the stairs and as he's getting in his car he says "I'll be back for you". I've order take out and delivery from these people so many times and I never had this experience. If I could could give them a negative star I would. I was threaten at my own home and I had soy sauce thrown at me. I will never again spend my money at this restaurant.

The $5.95 lunch special is what initially lured me into Chao Thai Restaurant, and believe me, that is a sweet deal for everything you get. The atmosphere when I walked in was a little chaotic - the waitress was obviously stressed out and the place was buzzing. I decided to get the Spicy Basil Tofu with a spicy level of 3. Less than a minute after taking my order, a small bowl of egg drop soup and a salad was placed before me. What? That's included in the lunch special? This is going to be a great lunch!

The egg drop soup was pretty tasty. It had tofu, green onions, and carrots in it. Unlike most egg drop soups I've tasted, this soup was packed with flavor and had just the right consistency. The salad was nice and crisp and the dressing was perfect. The only downer so far was that I got my drink after I was halfway through the soup and salad. 

Before I could finish the soup and salad, my entree came out. At first, I was weirded out by all the little green bits piled on the plate. Don't be scared of the green things! They're delicious. Anyways, the Spicy Basil Tofu was on point and came with a nice little mound of white rice and what I thought was a spring roll. Lo and behold, it's a fried banana egg roll! Yay! I get dessert too!

You simply can't beat Chao Thai Restaurant's $5.95 lunch specials. Thumbs Up

The chicken pad Thai is delicious! I've had it several times, whether it's in between classes or on the weekend. The service is great and the food is scrumptious. Also, the prices are very affordable. I love this place!

What typically happens when you get back from your trip to a different country and you love their cuisine and start comparing them to versions you've had back home? You become a snob and nothing is good enough. Wrong! Only assholes do that. I've traveled to at least 26 countries and if I had that attitude/ mentality, I would never dine out again.

My recent trip to Bangkok, I had the pleasure of eating the best pad Thai ever from Thip Samai and I thought I will be ruined for life because nothing compares to it and that I'll come home with a snooty 'tude. Fresh local ingredients, the water, age-old recipe, ambiance and even ones personal state of mind/ emotions at the time all affect how we feel about food.

I've been craving for Thai food since I came home. This tiny restaurant is across the street from UNLV but from my building, it's a hike I was willing to take on a rainy day. I got here and realized I had forgotten my wallet in my car. I dug out $15 from my backpack. Ha! They have lunch specials for $6.60! No UNLV student goes hungry today.

I had the Pad Thai lunch special that came with a soup and salad. The soup is a clear broth with veggies. The salad was a tomato (that I can't eat), carrots and lettuce with a nice dressing. The pad Thai though...man, was I surprised! It was similar to Thip Samai minus the egg wrapper. They were generous with the yummy sauce. The noodles were well-coated with the sauce and it was a remarkable deep orange. Unlike the other Thai restaurants in town with pale looking pad Thai.

Thai restaurants have the best service compared to all other Asian restaurants. Always friendly, attentive and eager to please. This place was no exception. However, seating is sparse so you may have to wait if they're busy.
So much better than the last place that was here. Incredible, cheap lunch specials, crisp fresh food, and great service! Chao Thai just became my go-to lunch spot off campus. Great Panang curry!
Just amazing. Came from miami for vacation and this place is great from the service to the amazing dishes.
Very good food! Good presentation! And it has lunch special with a whole meal! Love this place!

Ok any item beef is $1.00 more on lunch menu. Lunch is $5.95 or $6.95.  Their soup was awful.  Soup was egg srop but with large macaroni noodles in. It. Brith wasnt good. .  Salad is iceberg.  We ordered pana.g curry heat level 3. 8it was,really hot and actual peppers with seeds were in it.  Mouth was burning up.   White rice.  Curry ok.  Egg roll on plate covered in that awful sweet red sauce.   The most freaky part was after we were seated I heard someone tell a customer at counter she had a bug on her. I turned around to see a 2 inch ROACH black, now dropping to the floor. Restaurant was packed and not one of the guys moved to kill it. I spun around, got up, and smashed the roach. I sure wasn't going to let that sucker live!   One young dude thanked me for saving everyone.  My adrenaline had kicked in and I couldn't nust watch wveryine else let it get away.  We then checked the bathriom, it was clean, kitchen looked clean, health dept rating of A, so we went ahead and ordered.  People felt the roach came in on the girls pant leg, frim outside the shop.  The cooks and servers are asian with accents, FOB.  It was not good enoigh, and not enough food. I wouldn't go back.

Ordered take out lunch for a large (15 people) group. Placing the order by phone was very easy, prices were exceptionally reasonable (like $7 for an entree including salad), the order was fulfilled perfectly. Food was really good and several people mentioned how tasty their meal was. If you're looking for some very tasty, yet inexpensive Thai food, definitely go!
Sort of a hidden gem because of the location.  Great taste , price and amount of food is above average.  They also have lunch specials.
I just now caught a member of the kitchen staff using the dumpster in the back as a toilet. Hope he washed his hands.

New management please dont come here its crap. I used to love their spicy basil beef that came with fried rice and their stuffed chicken wings so i ordered my usually and it was soo so so disappointing. Where are the original owners please come back!

Great tucked away little spot right across from UNLV student union for some delicious, quick and affordable Thai food!

They always greet you warmly when you come in and are always so attentive throughout your meal. You won't sip your drink 3 times without getting it topped off :)

If you're a regular, you can walk in and they will have your order put in before you even have to say anything. Their service is that impeccable :) 

Been here a few times already, but today I switched it up from my usual pad se ew and tried their pumpkin curry with beef. I knew right away I made a great choice. Perfect balance of sweet (pumpkin), savory (curry) and spicy. First time ever trying pumpkin curry and it did not disappoint. Also had their vegetable curry puffs, a house favorite, and those were delicious also. 

Small family owned place, great food, excellent service and easy on the wallet for that college student budget!

I was really craving Thai food one day and convinced my boyfriend to come here for lunch. The service is friendly and the servers were attentive to our needs and pretty quick with the food service.

I ordered the pad-see-ewe. Just know that they will ask you on a scale from 1-5 (5 as very very spicy) for spiciness. I was feeling a bit naive that afternoon and asked for a 2 instead of a 1. When the dish arrived, I actually enjoyed the noodles - however the aftertaste of burnt tongue really isn't that desirable. I was able to scarf it down, but I couldn't enjoy my lunch as much as I wanted since it was just TOO spicy for me.

My boyfriend had the Crying Tiger, which is just marinated beef steak with some spices. It was good, but a bit too salty for our taste.

The Thai iced tea was refreshing and yummy! As for dessert, we ordered the sticky rice mango. It was my first time tasting this dessert (yes, I know - I am so deprived) and it was decadent and delicious! I couldn't eat as much as I would like since I was already full from my entree and drink - but nonetheless, I enjoyed it.

I ordered pad thai for my lunch special. These are some great things about it: 
1. Pad thai comes with soup and salad
2. Around $7.5 for a lunch combo so it's cheap

Cons: 
1. The lady server was not friendly ( she did not smiled at me until the paying stage!) 
2. The pad thai was a bit oversauced that made it utterly divided
3. They gave my frozen lemons when I asked for some to squeeze into my padthai!

I will probably come back for a takeout not dine in.
Best food in town & the service is amazing! Very hard to find a resturant who provides both but these guys go above and beyond & the food is superb!  Now our favorite spot!!

I ordered a spicy chicken basil and the food's presentation looks pretty bad... (kindda like dog food) and my friend ordered a chicken pad thai and it was sour. I asked for brown rice and they serve me white rice and took another 15 minutes to bring my order back with brown rice. The service was dedinitely not up to par. Had to repeatedly ask for a glass of water which it eventually arrived after 10 minutes. I don't know why they got decent reviews when they're really not good at all. If you want good Thai food go try Pin Kaow.

I absolutely love Thai food and am always looking for a good place to eat around town.  We had the calamari and a chicken pad woon sen.  The calamari was good but was kind of greasy.  I love all the cilantro and the dipping sauce but there was a lot of batter.  
The pad woon sen was really good - one of the better ones that I have had in town.  It was not the best one that I have EVER had but still very good.  The service was great, people there were very attentive and prompt.  I would definitely eat here again.

"Meh. I've experienced better." is completely true. I think I learned a lesson to 1) Only order off the lunch menu and 2) Only order take-out. 

I came in for a study break seeking comfort in green curry. I always order the same thing: green curry with chicken. Most Thai restaurants have their own variations (addition/subtraction of vegetables) and most always have the same flavors and textures. I'm definitely not picky, and mostly leave happy with a belly full of green curry. 

Chao Thai's green curry (which isn't on the lunch special, no big deal) is watery as ever and served with only egg plant and bamboo shoots. If it were watery and the flavors were still alive, I'd have been satisfied, but it was the blandest curry I have had... bland curry seems to be a paradox. I don't know if they ran out of green bell pepper, or consciously meant to cut uncooked jalapeño to look like green bell pepper, but it did not fool me for a second!! Ordering a spice of 2/5 I'm not really sure why raw jalapeños made it in the dish. The rice they serve with the curry is laughable especially with how watery it is. 

On top of my sadness from the great reviews from Yelp and my poor curry, the waitress hated my existence. She hated that I was there and that I thanked her, she hated that I paid, and hated that I left. Bad days do occur, so maybe I caught her on one. To end on a good note, similar price point to other restaurants and pretty tasty Thai Iced Coffee!

This place has a great food that taste just like the food in Thailand. I would recommend to everyone come and eat here. This place has the best food that I had ever been to and I would come and eat here again for sure.

Thai Chao is the perfect place to get lunch. They have a lunch special for $6.95, and that comes with a small salad and soup. The service was great, and everyone at the restaurant seemed very gracious and kind. I will definitely be going back soon!
Love this place!! I've had the appetizers, their pad Thai, teriyaki chicken and chow mein, all of which are delicious and fresh!! Great prices for such great tasting food.
The meal was so good. A little spicy at a 3. Next time a 1.5 or 2.  Service was top notch.  I will return to this hidden gem.

I used to always come here for lunch during fall and spring semester at UNLV. I really liked taking my friends here too. I'm pretty upset to have to write this review because I'm annoyed that one of my favorite lunch spots just became one I will never come back to again. 

Their panang curry is really good! It's definitely worth a try. The pad see ew was okay, but a little salty. The pad Thai was too sour in my opinion. I don't know if it's just a different chef today or just a change to their recipe. It was just not the same. 

The lady at the counter was nice at first. She continued to refill our drinks and everything. I asked for a box. After I put the food away,  I asked for a plastic bag and I swear she gave me the dirtiest look I have ever seen.  No exaggeration either! Even my friend and my boyfriend were shocked by the face she made.  

Gosh,  if you want customers to come back to your restaurant,  then maybe you should save your attitude for when the customer leaves. This is the first time I've ever experienced this in a restaurant.
Best duck ever and best service I've had in any Asian restaurant. Food comes really fast and classic Asian food
